m.DESC: Number of edges attached from new nodes to existing nodes

Barabasi-Albert.DESC: The <ansired>Barabasi-Albert</ansired> (BA) model is an algorithm for generating random scale-free networks using a preferential attachment mechanism.
PROP: The total number of undirected edges is <ansired>m</ansired>(<ansired>n</ansired>-<ansired>m</ansired>)

Complete.DESC: A <ansired>complete</ansired> graph is a simple undirected graph in which every pair of distinct vertices is connected by a unique edge.
PROP: The total number of undirected edges is <ansired>n</ansired> choose 2 = <ansired>n</ansired>(<ansired>n</ansired>-1)/2
The degree of every node (and thus also the average degree) is <ansired>n</ansired>-1
